name: inositol
Reason: The target compound inositol has six hydroxyl (OH) groups attached to a six-membered ring. The basic unit we can consider is cyclohexane, which has a melting point of around 6.5°C. Each hydroxyl group will significantly raise the melting point due to the strong intermolecular hydrogen bonding between the molecules. Assuming each hydroxyl group contributes approximately 35°C to the melting point due to hydrogen bonding (which is an educated estimate for hydroxyl functional groups considering their strong hydrogen bonding potential), we can calculate the melting point increment as 6 OH groups * 35°C = 210°C increment. Adding this increment to the base value of cyclohexane provides a predicted melting point.
